channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Olivia Hussey, Star of a Renowned ‘Romeo and Juliet,’ Dies at 73
item.description: Her passionate portrayal of Juliet in Franco Zeffirelli’s 1968 film adaptation won enduring acclaim. In 2023, she sued over the circumstances of a nud...

item.title: MacKenzie Scott’s game-changing philanthropy still mystifies nonprofits: ‘Her gifts are super generous, but unfortunately, they don’t provide long term sustainability’
item.description: "What they are saying with trust-based philanthropy is to offer support beyond a check," Indiana University's Pamela Wiepking says, "and that’s typica...

item.title: Considering Dry January? Here’s what experts say you’ll gain (and lose)
item.description: Does Dry January change drinking habits for the long haul? The evidence is mixed but promising for those who approach it mindfully.

item.title: Boeing Shares Drop After South Korea Plane Crash
item.description: A widely used Boeing aircraft, the 737-800, was involved in Sunday’s crash-landing of a Jeju Air flight that killed 179 people.

item.title: Kremlin threatens retaliation as European Telegram ban of Russian state media sparks outrage
item.description: With Europe’s crackdown on Russian state media intensifying, the country's foreign ministry threatens payback.

item.title: Lebanon’s Economy Reels From Israel-Hezbollah War
item.description: The conflict between Israel and Hezbollah may be suspended, but the damage is immense. “We came out of this war with nothing,” one man said.

item.title: Disposable vapes axed in Belgium in European first to stem youth addiction
item.description: Belgium eliminates single-use e-cigarettes to curb rising nicotine dependence among the young.

item.title: Jimmy Carter’s Quiet but Monumental Work in Global Health
item.description: In his decades as a former president, he and his wife, Rosalynn Carter, helped bring lifesaving treatments and sanitation to poor people around the wo...

item.title: For CEOs: burnout, exodus and breath control
item.description: A record number of CEOs have announced this year that they’re stepping down: 1,991 and counting.

item.title: Where Is Russia Finding New Soldiers? Wherever It Can.
item.description: From murder suspects to immigrants to a former Olympic gold medalist, Russia pressures those it thinks should fight in Ukraine.

item.title: How Top Pollsters Grade 2024’s Polls
item.description: Despite a pretty accurate year, the pre-election polls once again underestimated support for Donald Trump. Does that make it a successful polling cycl...

item.title: Azerbaijan Blames Russia for Plane Crash and Rebukes Kremlin

item.title: Hydropower Was Ecuador’s Answer to Climate Change. Until the Drought Hit.

item.title: Jimmy Carter Dies at 100, and Questions Surround South Korean Plane Crash
item.description: Plus, why coffee prices are soaring.
